title: St Helens' Jonny Lomax hoping to cap 'one of his best seasons' with Super League Grand Final glory for first time
text:
Eyebrows were raised when St Helens and England stand-off Jonny Lomax was omitted from the five-man shortlist for this year’s Steve Prescott Man of Steel award.

Lomax helped Saints to finish top by a staggering 16 points, a British rugby league record, and has been the creative fulcrum in a side who have played with such style and panache all year.

That he collected three player of the year awards at St Helens - from his coach, his team-mates and supporters - made Lomax's absence from the Man of Steel reckoning all the more mystifying.

The winner of the game's highest individual honour went to Salford Red Devils scrum-half Jackson Hastings, who will face Lomax in Saturday’s Grand Final at Old Trafford.

The battle between the respective playmakers adds intrigue to the title decider, especially after Hastings recently hailed Lomax as the finest talent in Super League.

“I'm not the best player in this competition, I've got so many flaws and deficiencies in my game,” Hastings said after Salford beat Castleford Tigers in the second round of the play-offs. “I've said it all along, Jonny Lomax is the best player in Super League; his skill set is remarkable and he makes the game look so easy.”
